Also Read:

Ever wonder if a college degree is the secret to billions? The world's richest people broke not only the bank but also quite some interesting educational paths. Here are the educational journeys of elite Ivy League dropouts and people who followed rather odd routes to great wealth.Did Jeff Bezos dream of e-commerce while studying engineering? What did Elon Musk learn before targeting Mars? Does Bill Gates regret leaving Harvard? Their answers might shock you! Whether they earned fancy diplomas or dropped class to join startups, these 10 billionaires show that the road to riches is as varied as it is inspiring. So get ready to dive into their educational stories.Elon Musk, the CEO of Tesla Motors, attended Queen's University in Canada but would later move to the United States to attend the University of Pennsylvania to pursue degrees in business and physics. His desire was thus fulfilled where he could be more entrepreneurial and up-to-date with the world of technology. His quest for deeper knowledge led him to Stanford University in California to pursue a PhD in energy physics. However, after being at Stanford for only two days, he decided to pursue his entrepreneurial pursuits and left college. Although Musk never completed that program, this educational background largely molded his revolutionary ideas in matters related to technology and business.Jeff Bezos, the founder and executive chairman of Amazon, graduated from Princeton University, where he earned degrees in electrical engineering and computer science. His time at Princeton was pivotal in shaping his future, as the knowledge he gained in these fields laid the groundwork for his innovative work in technology and e-commerce. With a strong foundation in both engineering and computer science, Bezos combined technical expertise with a visionary mindset to revolutionize the retail industry. He founded Amazon, which is today the global powerhouse it is.Larry Ellison initially started as a pre-med student at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign but later left before completion of his studies. He thereafter enrolled in the University of Chicago where he majored in physics and mathematics. But he did not graduate. Even though he dropped out from both high school and the University of Illinois early in his academic life, Ellison had become passionate about technology and innovation, which led to co-founding Oracle as it revolutionized the soft-ware industry. It is an enlightening reminder of how educational pathways are not the definitive route to success; rather, passion sometimes leads to incredible feats.Mark Zuckerberg first went to Harvard University to study psychology and computer science. Yet, after only two years, he quit college and took up the entrepreneurial career to pursue his goals. Focusing on Facebook was much more important to him than any college where he might have spent most of his time developing the social media platform that would change the course of connectivity among online users. Although he did not graduate from Harvard, dropping out marked the beginning of an incredible journey that made him one of the most influential figures in the tech world and one of the wealthiest individuals in the world.Bernard Arnault is the man behind the LVMH empire, which comprises brands such as Louis Vuitton and cosmetics giant Sephora. He graduated from École Polytechnique in Paris with a Bachelor of Arts and Science. This institution formed the basis for Arnault's incredible journey into the world of high-end fashion and cosmetics. His education was well-equipped with the analytical skills and business acumen that would later help him build one of the most influential luxury conglomerates in the world. Arnault's success story shows how a strong academic background can blend with entrepreneurial vision to create global dominance.Larry Page, the co-founder of Google, graduated with a Bachelor of Science degree in computer engineering from the University of Michigan. While studying at Michigan, he established a strong background in computer science that eventually made him interested in search engine technology. Page later continued his studies for a PhD in computer science at Stanford University, where he met Sergey Brin. Together, they worked on a research project that eventually became Google. Page left his PhD program to focus on developing Google, but his academic background played a crucial role in shaping the innovative approach that led to the creation of one of the world's most successful tech companies.Sergey Brin graduated with honors from the University of Maryland, College Park, with a Bachelor's degree in mathematics and computer science. He later acquired his Master's degree in computer science from Stanford University. At this time, he was awarded a National Science Foundation Graduate Fellowship, an award that recognizes potential to grow into new talent in technology. This is where Larry Page came into his life, and he and Page started on a journeythat transformed the tech industry itself, making him the man behind Google, the world's leading search engine.Warren Buffett studied business at the University of Nebraska–Lincoln, graduating with a Bachelor of Science in Economics in 1950. After that, he studied economics at Columbia Business School, earning a Master of Science in Economics in 1951. At Columbia, he was under the mentorship of Benjamin Graham, one of the most important economists and investors, whose value investing principles Buffett used to great effect in his investment strategies.Steve Ballmer graduated from Harvard University in 1977, earning a Bachelor of Arts degree in Applied Mathematics and Economics. He later attended Stanford Graduate School of Business, graduating with an MBA in 1980. His academic exposure to applied mathematics, economics, and business paved the way for his professional life at Microsoft. After joining the company in 1980, he became very close to Bill Gates, eventually taking on the position of CEO from 2000-2014 and steering the company through growth that turned it into one of the world's most valuable tech companies.The founder and CEO of NVIDIA, Jensen Huang, has impressive academic credentials. He earned his Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering from Oregon State University. He further went on to obtain his Master's degree in Electrical Engineering at Stanford University. Huang's education in electrical engineering laid a foundation for his future career in technology and semiconductor industries. In 1993, he founded NVIDIA which he co-founded and made a leader in graphics processing units and AI technology that creates innovations in gaming, data centers, and artificial intelligence.
Article Summary: Elon Musk attended Queen's University in Canada but would later move to the U.S. to attend the University of Pennsylvania to pursue degrees in business and physics. Jeff Bezos, the founder and executive chairman of Amazon, graduated from Princeton University, where he earned degrees in electrical engineering and computer science. Larry Page, the co-founder of Google, graduated with a Bachelor of Science degree in computer engineering from University of Michigan.

Article Title: Bill Gates predicts the next COVID19 like pandemic: "The chance of a pandemic is..."
Article Text:
Bill Gates

Microsoft cofounder Bill Gates predicts a sobering scenario for global health, estimating a 10-15% chance of another pandemic emerging within the next four years, according to a recent Wall Street Journal interview."The chance of a natural pandemic in the next four years is somewhere between 10 and 15 percent," Gates stated emphatically. "And it'd be nice to think we're actually more ready for that than we were last time.But so far we're not."When pressed about global preparedness, Gates was unequivocal: "We're absolutely not" ready for another potential outbreak. His assessment stems from ongoing concerns about worldwide health infrastructure and lessons learned from the COVID-19 pandemic.Gates has been a persistent voice in pandemic preparedness for years. In a 2015 TED Talk, he presciently warned that the world was unprepared for a deadly outbreak—a prediction that proved tragically accurate during the coronavirus pandemic. Subsequently, he authored "How to Prevent the Next Pandemic" in 2022, offering comprehensive recommendations for global health strategy.The billionaire philanthropist argues that political divisions and insufficient global cooperation continue to hamper effective pandemic prevention. "People, rather than having a consensus about what tools are missing, are mostly still replaying the various mistakes that were made," he explained.His concerns are backed by scientific research indicating that pandemics are becoming more likely due to factors such as climate change and increasing population density. Gates has consistently advocated for stronger quarantine policies, increased investment in disease monitoring, and accelerated vaccine research and development.

Article Title: After Gaurav Taneja, Shark Tank judge Anupam Mittal tells influencer-turned-founder: ‘Isse Acha Thela Laga Lo’

Article Title: Davis Cup; For full house, DLTA offers free tickets
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The organisers are expecting a full house when the Davis Cup returns to Delhi's famous DLTA Complex after a gap of over eight years with India taking on Togo in a World Group 1 playoff on the weekend. The last time a Davis Cup tie was held here, India lost 0-5 to Rafael Nadal's Spain in Sept 2016.Crowds had thronged the 5000-capacity stadium in large numbers then to watch live action, even though Nadal did not play singles due to a wrist issue and featured only in the doubles tie.Delhi Lawn Tennis Association (DLTA) president Rohit Rajpal , also the captain of the Indian team, said arrangements have been made to en sure a capacity crowd for the tie even though India take on an unfancied team."Davis Cup is a very special occasion and we normally have a full house. We are making every effort to reach out to whoever needs tickets - tennis clubs, schools, colleges as well as junior players and making sure that they come and watch these national players in action," Rajpal told TOI. "We are giving out tickets free of cost."Rajpal said he was happy to see the Davis Cup back at the stadium which hosted the tennis events in the 1982 Asian Games as well as 2010 Commonwealth Games."Davis Cup is very important. When you get an opportunity to host it, tennis lovers get a chance to see it live. It's one thing to watch it on TV and another to watch the players live and see them perform under pressure from close. That makes a lot of difference to all the young players."Rajpal also revealed that the venue will host an international event - the Delhi Open - next month. "We have a Delhi Open coming which will bring players from 25 to 30 countries. These Indian Davis Cup players will be there. We're working on making it into a property that keeps growing. As India prepares to host big events and hopefully the 2036 Olympics, it's very important to be able to have large scale events in different cities where the organisers can learn how to host world class tournaments in India."
Article Summary: India take on Togo in a World Group 1 playoff on the weekend. The last time a Davis Cup tie was held here, India lost 0-5 to Rafael Nadal's Spain in Sept 2016. Delhi Lawn Tennis Association president Rohit Rajpal said arrangements have been made to en sure a capacity crowd for the tie.

Article Text:
Increase in the number of tigers in the state

Efforts will be made to increase the forest sector

Encouragement of private forestry

Measures to prevent tiger deaths

MUMBAI: Forest minister Ganesh Naik said that the number of tigers in the state has increased by an average of 350 in the last sixteen years. As per the directives of the Central Government, efforts will be made to increase the forest area in the state to 30 percent of the total geographical area, he added.Twelve tigers died in various incidents in the state between December 30, 2024 and January 22, 2025. Five tigers died due to natural causes such as injuries from conflicts, illness, etc. Four tigers died due to shock from electric wires installed for other animals. Or due to collision with vehicles. In three cases, it has been revealed that the tigers died due to poaching. A total of nine accused have been arrested by the Forest Department in all these three cases.The state had 103 tigers in 2006. In 2010, this number increased to 169. In 2014, this increased further to 190. In 2018, the number of tigers was 312. In the 2022 tiger census, the number of tigers was recorded at 444. As per the instructions of the Central Government, tiger census is conducted every four years. The next census will be held in 2026 , said forest minister Shri Naik.According to the Central Government's directives, the state's forest area should be at least 30 percent. Accordingly, efforts will be made to increase the forest area of Maharashtra from 21 percent to 30 percent. If wild fruit trees like Raiwal mango , Bor , Jambhol etc. are planted in the core area of forests, then there will be food available for herbivores and carnivores. Therefore, tigers will not come to human settlements in search of food , said forest minister Ganesh Naik.An advanced variety of Jambhal is produced in Bahadoi in Palghar. Forest minister Ganesh Naik said that instructions have been given to prepare world-class Jambhal seedlings from the Forest Department's nursery and plant them in various divisions of the Forest Department.Shri. Naik asserted that there is a need to encourage private forestry. As suggested by chief minister Devendra Fadnavis, modern nurseries will be set up in every district. As the guardian minister of Palghar district, forest minister Shri. Ganesh Naik said that Janata Darbar will soon be organized in various talukas of this district.- Measures for the protection of tigers, leopards and other wild animals are being planned in the district-level tiger committee meeting .- Preventive measures are being taken by the Forest Department and Mahavitaran Company to prevent tiger deaths due to electric shock.- Informants have been appointed at the district level to obtain information about illegal hunters.- Regular patrols are conducted in highly sensitive areas by a team of Tiger Conservation Force. Also, patrols are conducted under the dog squad to control poaching activities.- Mobile phones with M-Stripes system have been supplied to field staff. Through this, suspicious movements can be monitored.- A wireless messaging system has been implemented in highly sensitive areas.- A Wildlife Crime Cell has been set up at the Office of the Principal Chief Conservator of Forests , Nagpur to maintain up-to-date information on crime cases related to wildlife in the state .- The cyber cell set up at the Melghat Tiger Reserve is used to track down the accused in poaching incidents.- Checkpoints have been set up at necessary places in highly sensitive areas.- At the district level, a specific tracking program for wild animals such as tigers and leopards is implemented to obtain information about their existence.- Camera traps are installed on tiger migration routes , water bodies and important locations to monitor suspicious movements. Also, water bodies are regularly inspected to ensure that no poisons are being used in the water.- Metal detectors will be used to ensure that no iron traps have been set by hunters on the path leading to the water body.

Article Title: Goa CM urges school picnics at science institutes, not beaches
Article Text:
He suggested such visits would inspire students, fostering a greater interest in science and technology, and highlighted Goa's top performance in coding and robotics.

PANAJI: Chief minister Pramod Sawant on Wednesday urged schools to adopt a shift in school picnic destinations , urging them to visit science institutions like the National Institute of Oceanography (NIO) and the National Centre for Polar and Ocean Research (NCPOR) etc., instead of beaches. Sawant made the appeal during the inauguration of the Science film festival of India (SCIFFI) 2025 in Panaji.He said that such visits would inspire and educate students, sparking a greater interest in science and technology. He suggested exposing students to scientific environments would further nurture their interest and skills in these crucial fields.Speaking on Goa's role in coding and robotics, Sawant pointed out the achievement of Goan students. "Out of 100 students selected in coding and robotics in India, 22 students are Goans. Goa is therefore one of the top-performing states in coding compared to other states," he said.
Article Summary: Chief minister Pramod Sawant urged schools to adopt a shift in school picnic destinations. He suggested such visits would inspire students, fostering a greater interest in science and technology. Sawant highlighted Goa's top performance in coding and robotics.

Article Title: For Manipur wushu team, medals the answer to struggles back home
Article Text: DEHRADUN: When 25-year-old Athokpam James Meitei from Manipur won gold in wushu at the 2023 National Games , his native state had been caught in conflict for months. Despite the turmoil, he secured a spot on the podium. But preparing for this year's edition in Uttarakhand came with greater challenges.With the conflict in its second year, James, whose father runs a pig farm, had to stay in a hotel near the stadium - 16 km from home in Imphal East - for six months to train safely. "Traveling back and forth daily was risky as tension could erupt anytime. It was not easy to train in such conditions. We could often hear sounds of gunshots and bombs going off nearby," he told TOI. He added that he struggled to maintain a proper diet, but parents of some junior players living near the stadium provided him with meals. James, competing in the 56 kg category, has been practising wushu for 10 years.He said his family met him before leaving for the Games and added, "They wished me the best and asked me to travel safely. Despite all the challenges, I hope to give my best to defend my gold medal." Like James, the remaining 38 members of the Manipur wushu team fought through hardships to compete and are determined to bring pride to their state, offering a ray of happiness amid the turmoil and terror.Romajit Singh, 35, competing in the 60kg category, said he commuted 16km daily from his home in Imphal East, while constantly fearing about his family's safety. "While training, I was always anxious about the safety of my family. Seeing a missed call from them after practice would send my mind racing with negative thoughts. Only we know how we trained under such conditions to participate in the competition," said Singh, the sole breadwinner for his mother, wife and two children.Their coach, Arjuna awardee M Bimoljit Singh , said, "Despite the situation in the state, we did our best to ensure that our players were not affected by it much. We made them understand that the National Games is not just a sporting event but a stage to prove themselves before the world."Among the 39 wushu players from Manipur, 20 are women, including Khaidem Panthoi Devi, 20, from Bishnupur, and Tongbram Saya , 18, from Imphal West. Despite it being their first National Games, both secured podium finishes in wushu's 'changquan' discipline. While Saya won gold, Devi won a silver.Coach H Dewan Singh, who represented India in two wushu world championships, said: "After all the struggles we faced to get here, winning medals is the only answer. It will bring smiles to the faces of our people back home, who are enduring such difficult times."
Article Summary: Athokpam James Meitei from Manipur won gold in wushu at the 2023 National Games. The 25-year-old had to stay in a hotel near the stadium - 16 km from home in Imphal East - for six months to train safely. He said: "Traveling back and forth daily was risky as tension could erupt anytime"

Article Title: Musk: Elon Musk says Twitter in precarious position, defends cost cuts
Article Text:
"I will resign as CEO as soon as I find someone foolish enough to take the job!" Musk said.

SAN FRANCISCO: Elon Musk is defending his massive cost-cutting at Twitter as necessary for the social media platform to survive next year, due in part to debt payments tied to his $44 billion takeover of the company."This company is like, basically, you're in a plane that is headed towards the ground at high speed with the engines on fire and the controls don't work," Musk told a late-night audience on a Twitter Spaces call Tuesday.That's after Elon Musk said earlier on Tuesday that he plans on remaining as Twitter's CEO until he can find someone willing to replace him in the job.Musk's announcement came after millions of Twitter users asked him to step down in an online poll the billionaire himself created and promised to abide by."I will resign as CEO as soon as I find someone foolish enough to take the job!" Musk tweeted. "After that, I will just run the software & servers teams."Since taking over the San Francisco social media platform in late October, Musk's run as CEO has been marked by quickly issued rules and policies that have often been withdrawn or changed soon after being made public.Musk said Tuesday night that he "spent the last five weeks cutting costs like crazy" and trying to build a stronger paid subscription service because otherwise Twitter might be operating with $3 billion in negative cash flow next year. He in part blamed the $12.5 billion in debt tied to his April agreement to buy the company, as well as the Federal Reserve's recent interest rate hikes.Some of Musk's actions have unnerved Twitter advertisers and turned off users. He has laid off more than half of Twitter's workforce, released contract content moderators and disbanded a council of trust and safety advisors that the company formed in 2016 to address hate speech and other problems on the platform.The Tesla CEO has also alienated investors at his electric vehicle company over concerns that Twitter is taking too much of his attention, and possibly offending loyal customers.Even more unnerving for investors, Tesla shares are plummeting.Shares of Tesla are down 35% since Musk took over Twitter on Oct. 27, costing investors billions. Tesla's market value was over $1.1 trillion on April 1, the last trading day before Musk disclosed he was buying up Twitter shares. The company has since lost 58% of its value, at a time when rival auto makers are cutting in on Tesla's dominant share of electric vehicle sales.Shares fell Wednesday, as they have every day this week.A single share of Tesla that cost about $400 to start the year, can now be had for less than $140.Musk sought to defend some of his recent Twitter decisions on the Twitter Spaces call."They may seem sometimes spurious or odd or whatever," Musk said. "It's because we have an emergency fire drill on our hands. That's the reason. Not because I'm naturally capricious. Or at least, aspirationally, I'm not naturally capricious."Musk, who also helms the SpaceX rocket company, has previously acknowledged how difficult it will be to find someone to take over as Twitter CEO .Bantering with Twitter followers earlier this week, he said that the person replacing him "must like pain a lot" to run a company that he said has been "in the fast lane to bankruptcy.""No one wants the job who can actually keep Twitter alive. There is no successor," Musk tweeted.As things stand, Musk would still retain overwhelming influence over platform as its owner. He fired the company's board of directors soon after taking control.
Article Summary: Elon Musk says he plans on remaining as Twitter's CEO until he can find someone willing to replace him in the job. Musk's run as CEO has been marked by quickly issued rules and policies that have often been withdrawn or changed soon after being made public. Musk has laid off more than half of Twitter's workforce, released contract content moderators.
